distributional 0.5.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] 0.1229576 9.9355985
variance(dist)
#> [1] 0.8257350 0.8071246
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.3021126 -0.1830602
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] -0.5175422  0.8819632  1.0160871  0.3233392  0.2722770  0.4002660
#>  [7] -0.9952396  0.5181991  0.1367018 -0.2797198
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 10.841069 10.038402 10.038402  9.595117 10.435002  8.550844 10.093501
#>  [8]  9.360195  9.196560 10.093501
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.3385024 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))
dimnames(dist) <- c("x", "y")

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#>               x        y
#> [1,] 0.03784626 9.754326
variance(dist)
#>                x           y
#> [1,]  0.81610666 -0.01130409
#> [2,] -0.01130409  0.95266451
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>                 x         y
#>  [1,] -1.12394125 10.889834
#>  [2,]  0.50538569 11.032982
#>  [3,]  0.29605731 11.143758
#>  [4,] -0.07397145 10.911054
#>  [5,]  1.24817304  8.275519
#>  [6,]  0.46579816  9.327514
#>  [7,] -1.39818854 10.515622
#>  [8,] -0.50949153  8.692277
#>  [9,]  0.06432563  9.998956
#> [10,]  1.52421576  9.082829
#> 
quantile(dist, 0.4) # Returns the marginal quantiles
#>               x        y
#> [1,] -0.1378617 9.545156
cdf(dist, matrix(c(0.3,9), nrow = 1))
#> [1] 0.45
